name: Charles MacMahon

roles_in_work.title: For the term of his natural life

biography:
The MacMahon brothers were entrepreneurs in Australian show business. Chief among them were James MacMahon (1856 or c. 1858 – 29 April 1915) and Charles MacMahon  (1861 – 27 June 1917), who together and separately toured a large number of stage shows.
Their younger brothers, Joseph (died November 1918) and William (died August 1923), were involved in many of those activities.
In later years James acquired the nickname "Mighty Atom", perhaps a reference to Marie Corelli's novel. and Charles had some success as a filmmaker.
